Hebrews__03.1: Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly vocation, consider the apostle and high priest of our confession, Jesus:
Hebrews__03.2: Who is faithful to him that made him, as was also Moses in all his house.
Hebrews__03.3: For this man was counted worthy of greater glory than Moses, by so much as he that hath built the house, hath greater honour than the house.
Hebrews__03.4: For every house is built by some man: but he that created all things, is God.
Hebrews__03.5: And Moses indeed was faithful in all his house as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be said:
Hebrews__03.6: But Christ as the Son in his own house: which house are we, if we hold fast the confidence and glory of hope unto the end.
Hebrews__03.7: Wherefore, as the Holy Ghost saith: Today if you shall hear his voice,
Hebrews__03.8: Harden not your hearts, as in the provocation; in the day of temptation in the desert,
Hebrews__03.9: Where your fathers tempted me, proved and saw my works,
Hebrews__03.10: Forty years: for which cause I was offended with this generation, and I said: They always err in heart. And they have not known my ways,
Hebrews__03.11: As I have sworn in my wrath: If they shall enter into my rest.
Hebrews__03.12: Take heed, brethren, lest perhaps there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, to depart from the living God.
Hebrews__03.13: But exhort one another every day, whilst it is called today, that none of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.
Hebrews__03.14: For we are made partakers of Christ: yet so, if we hold the beginning of his substance firm unto the end.
Hebrews__03.15: While it is said, Today if you shall hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in that provocation.
Hebrews__03.16: For some who heard did provoke: but not all that came out of Egypt by Moses.
Hebrews__03.17: And with whom was he offended forty years? Was it not with them that sinned, whose carcasses were overthrown in the desert?
Hebrews__03.18: And to whom did he swear, that they should not enter into his rest: but to them that were incredulous?
Hebrews__03.19: And we see that they could not enter in, because of unbelief.
